channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 'The West Wing' cast visited the White House to celebrate the show's 25th anniversary
item.description: The cast and creators of the hit political drama West Wing celebrated the series' 25th anniversary during a visit to the White House.
item.content:encoded:
The cast and creators of the hit political drama West Wing celebrated the series' 25th anniversary during a visit to the White House.

(Image credit: Samuel Corum)
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: New center-right government in France announced 2 months after divisive elections
item.description: The French presidential palace unveiled a new government dominated by conservatives and centrists. A left-wing coalition secured the most seats in June-July elections but failed to win a majority.
item.content:encoded:
The French presidential palace unveiled a new government dominated by conservatives and centrists. A left-wing coalition secured the most seats in June-July elections but failed to win a majority.

(Image credit: Michel Euler)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Okinawa's governor strives for regional diplomacy as tensions in Asia-Pacific rise
item.description: Denny Tamaki, governor of Okinawa prefecture, says his personal story is deeply entwined with the U.S. military’s presence on the island.
item.content:encoded:
Denny Tamaki, governor of Okinawa prefecture, says his personal story is deeply entwined with the U.S. military’s presence on the island.

(Image credit: Behrouz Mehri)
item.dc:creator: Monica Miller

item.title: A new 'mini-moon' comes to Earth this fall
item.description: An newly discovered asteroid will be captured by Earth's gravity this fall. The "mini-moon" will spend about two months in Earth's orbit, before being flung back on its normal path around the sun.
item.content:encoded:
An newly discovered asteroid will be captured by Earth's gravity this fall. The "mini-moon" will spend about two months in Earth's orbit, before being flung back on its normal path around the sun.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: FTC sues insulin middlemen, saying they pocket billions while patients face high costs
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission said pharmacy benefit managers created a "perverse drug rebate system" that artificially inflated the cost of insulin.
item.content:encoded:
The Federal Trade Commission said pharmacy benefit managers created a "perverse drug rebate system" that artificially inflated the cost of insulin.

(Image credit: Frederick Florin)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: FBI agents board Baltimore ship linked to Singaporean company sued in bridge collapse
item.description: FBI agents boarded a vessel managed by the same company as the cargo ship that caused the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in March.
item.content:encoded:
FBI agents boarded a vessel managed by the same company as the cargo ship that caused the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in March.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: DOJ investigates Mississippi sheriff's office following 'Goon Squad' torture case
item.description: Last year, two Black men were beaten and tasered by six officers in a no-warrant house raid. Since then, the Justice Department said it got more complaints regarding similar instances by the deputies.
item.content:encoded:
Last year, two Black men were beaten and tasered by six officers in a no-warrant house raid. Since then, the Justice Department said it got more complaints regarding similar instances by the deputies.

(Image credit: Rogelio V. Solis)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Whooping cough cases spike in the U.S., after people missed vaccinations during pandemic
item.description: Infectious diseases experts say many Americans fell behind on their whooping cough vaccinations during the COVID-19 pandemic, which they say has compounded the recent uptick in cases.
item.content:encoded:
Infectious diseases experts say many Americans fell behind on their whooping cough vaccinations during the COVID-19 pandemic, which they say has compounded the recent uptick in cases.

(Image credit: Angie Wang)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: U.K. dads are wrapping baby slings on male statues to push for more paternity leave
item.description: The purpose is to raise awareness on the U.K.'s low paternity leave benefits, which currently stand at two weeks of paid time off for new fathers.
item.content:encoded:
The purpose is to raise awareness on the U.K.'s low paternity leave benefits, which currently stand at two weeks of paid time off for new fathers.

(Image credit: The Dad Shift)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Hazardous chemicals in food packaging can also be found in people
item.description: Chemicals used in food packaging and linked with health problems have been detected in the human body. The chemicals can move from packaging into food.
item.content:encoded:
Chemicals used in food packaging and linked with health problems have been detected in the human body. The chemicals can move from packaging into food.

(Image credit: J Rosello)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang
